page.title: 07Leatherhead Advertiser Items
page.content:
The following items are taken from the {Leatherhead Advertiser,}the local weekly paper which serves the whole of the Mole Valley District (18/07/85):
{Revised Surrey structure plan:}further 1900 homes are planned for Mole Valley by 2001, in addition to 3400 announced in 1980. Aim is to provide lower price housing making best use of space left.
{District's first test-tube triplets} returned home to Plough Inn Effingham.
{Reigate to Wisley section}of the M25 motorway to be opened soon.
{Mole Valley Councillors}trying to cut spending to keep rates down. Possible increase in price of{meals on wheels} (currently 85p each) or increased{car {parking charges}in Bookham & Ashtead.
